messages.content: What does the Image(s) to Websocket (Base64) node do in ComfyUI?
The Image(s) to Websocket (Base64) node accepts a batch of image tensors and returns an array of base64 encoded images using the websocket. It also returns a string (Actions) for routing.
How does the Load Image (Base64) node process data?
The Load Image (Base64) node accepts a base64 encoded image and returns an image tensor and mask.
What is the structure of input accepted by the Load Images (Base64) node?
The Load Images (Base64) node accepts a string with the structure: 0x4(Image count) 0x8(Image1 length) Image1(base64) ... 0x8(ImageN length) ImageN(base64).
What does the Load Images (Base64) node return as output?
The Load Images (Base64) node returns a batch of image tensors and masks.
Which node in ComfyUI Knodes can convert image tensors to base64 using websocket?
The Image(s) to Websocket (Base64) node can convert image tensors to base64 using websocket.
What is the function of the Load Image (Base64) node in ComfyUI?
The Load Image (Base64) node in ComfyUI decodes a base64 encoded image and outputs an image tensor and mask.
Which node in ComfyUI Knodes can process a batch of base64 encoded images into image tensors?
The Load Images (Base64) node can process a batch of base64 encoded images into image tensors.
What is the necessary output for routing after processing images with the Image(s) to Websocket (Base64) node?
The Image(s) to Websocket (Base64) node returns a string (Actions) for routing in addition to the base64 encoded images.
